intro: Oxytropis physodes var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers in dense clusters during the spring and summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Oxytropis physodes var. villosa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
